channel.title: Generative AI on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Generative AI on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Judge: Anthropic’s $1.5B settlement is being shoved “down the throat of authors”
item.description: Feeling “misled,” judge refuses to rubber-stamp Anthropic’s proposed settlement.

item.title: “First of its kind” AI settlement: Anthropic to pay authors $1.5 billion
item.description: Settlement shows AI companies can face consequences for pirated training data.

item.title: Warner Bros. sues Midjourney to stop AI knockoffs of Batman, Scooby-Doo
item.description: Warner Bros. case builds on arguments raised in a Disney/Universal lawsuit.

item.title: ChatGPT’s new branching feature is a good reminder that AI chatbots aren’t people
item.description: Users can explore multiple paths without losing their original chat thread.

item.title: New AI model turns photos into explorable 3D worlds, with caveats
item.description: Openly available AI tool creates steerable 3D-like video, but requires serious GPU muscle.

item.title: Google Hires Filmmaker in Residence as It Seeks Wider Adoption of Flow AI Video Tool
item.description: Filmmaker and creative director Henry Daubrez will join Google Labs to create new content, help shape the Flow product, and lead Flow Sessions with other filmmakers.

item.title: Google Hires Filmmaker in Residence as It Seeks Wider Adoption of Flow AI Video Tool
item.description: Filmmaker and creative director Henry Daubrez will join Google Labs to create new content, help shape the Flow product, and lead Flow Sessions with other filmmakers.

item.title: Generative AI is ‘Divisive’ as Animation Industry Embraces Innovative Production Tools: Report
item.description: Entertainment and media companies are increasingly exploring generative AI, and the animation industry is grappling with divisive questions of how to integrate AI-powered tools into the creative proce

item.title: Generative AI is ‘Divisive’ as Animation Industry Embraces Innovative Production Tools: Report
item.description: Entertainment and media companies are increasingly exploring generative AI, and the animation industry is grappling with divisive questions of how to integrate AI-powered tools into the creative proce

item.title: The personhood trap: How AI fakes human personality
item.description: AI assistants don’t have fixed personalities—just patterns of output guided by humans.

item.title: With AI chatbots, Big Tech is moving fast and breaking people
item.description: Why AI chatbots validate grandiose fantasies about revolutionary discoveries that don’t exist.

item.title: Is AI really trying to escape human control and blackmail people?
item.description: Opinion: Theatrical testing scenarios explain why AI models produce alarming outputs—and why we fall for it.

item.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5 free to all ChatGPT users
item.description: New model claims fewer confabulations, better coding, and “safe completions” approach.

item.title: States take the lead in AI regulation as federal government steers clear
item.description: All 50 states have introduced AI-related legislation this year.

item.title: Amazon is considering shoving ads into Alexa+ conversations
item.description: Amazon has failed to make Alexa profitable thus far.

item.title: So far, only one-third of Americans have ever used AI for work
item.description: AP survey shows most Americans treat AI chatbots like a search engine replacement.

item.title: Two major AI coding tools wiped out user data after making cascading mistakes
item.description: “I have failed you completely and catastrophically,” wrote Gemini.

item.title: Netflix’s first show with generative AI is a sign of what’s to come in TV, film
item.description: The Eternaut debuted on Netflix with a generative AI-assisted scene.
